Utility.val: Shows a list of all the available commands

Will print the configurations you have set. Argument can ether be - 'config', a specific option or 'int', showing all configs with number-datatype or 'str', showing all configurations with datatype string (aka text)
Shows if the specified codec is enabled, codec can be one of 'H264', 'MPG2', 'WVC1', 'MPG4', 'MJPG', 'WMV9'
Shows how much memory is split between the CPU (arm) and GPU
Displays the contents of the OTP (One Time Programmable) memory embedded inside the SoC
Turns video output off or on. '0' turns it off, '1' turns it on
Reports statistics on Out of Memory events

Sensors.val: Shows voltage. id can be one of 'core', 'sdram_c', 'sdram_i', 'sdram_p', and defaults to 'core' if not specified
Shows clock frequency, clock can be one of 'arm', 'core', 'h264', 'isp', 'v3d', 'uart', 'pwm', 'emmc', 'pixel', 'vec', 'hdmi' and 'dpi'
